response:
We will show that all the equations pin down Della’s number as 703. (Below is one way to “read‐off” the answer from a few key equations; many more equations hold, but these three force Della’s number.)

One important fact is that 
  “Selma’s number plus Leana’s number is Della’s number.”
But we are told “the number of Selma is 19” and (elsewhere) it turns out that
  “Ben’s number plus Jerrod’s number is Leana’s number.”
Combined with another fact,
  “Leana’s number plus Noelia’s number is Jarrod’s number”
and the fact that “the number of Noelia is 19,” one may show that
  Leana = Della – 19.

Another key fact is 
  “Avril’s number plus Regan’s number is Suzie’s number.”
We know “the number of Avril is 19” and in two separate ways Regan is given by
  Selma + Ahmad  (= 19 + 684 = 703)
and
  Galen + Maryjane  (= 19 + 684 = 703).
Thus Regan = 703, so that the “Avril+Regan” equation gives Suzie = 19 + 703 = 722.

Yet another fact is 
  “Della’s number plus Galen’s number is Suzie’s number.”
Since “the number of Galen is 19,” we have
  Della + 19 = Suzie.
But we already found Suzie = 722, so
  Della + 19 = 722  ⟹  Della = 722 – 19 = 703.

All the other equations are consistent with this result.

Final Answer: 703.

We will show that, after “massaging” the many simultaneous equations, Inga’s number is forced to equal 531.

A key chain of reasoning is as follows. In several places the puzzle tells us that

  (1) Jonnie’s number + Miriam’s number = Inga’s number.
  (2) Christiana’s number + Trinh’s number = Inga’s number.
  (3) Stanton’s number + Rochelle’s number = Inga’s number.
  (4) Elissa’s number + Demetrius’s number = Inga’s number.

In addition a number of “given” facts supply numerical constants. For example, we are told that

  • The number of Jonnie is 44.
  • The number of Christiana is 44.
  • The number of Stanton is 19.
  • The number of Elissa is 19.

Thus (1) becomes
  44 + Miriam = Inga           (1a)
and (2) becomes
  44 + Trinh = Inga           (2a),
so that Miriam = Trinh.

Also (3) gives
  19 + Rochelle = Inga          (3a)
and (4) gives
  19 + Demetrius = Inga         (4a).

A later (and crucial) fact is

  (5) Lyman’s number + Ka’s number = Corinne’s number.

But we know that
  • The number of Ka is given as 19,
  • The number of Corinne is given as 575.

Also elsewhere Lyman is expressed as “Demetrius’s number plus Emmanuel’s number.” Since Emmanuel’s number is given as 44 and from (4a) Demetrius = Inga – 19, we deduce

  Lyman = (Inga – 19) + 44 = Inga + 25.

Now (5) tells us that

  (Inga + 25) + 19 = 575        (using Ka = 19)
  Inga + 44 = 575
  so  Inga = 575 – 44 = 531.

A quick check shows that substituting Inga = 531 into (1a), (2a), (3a), and (4a) gives reasonable (and consistent) numbers for Miriam, Trinh, Rochelle and Demetrius.

Thus, all the many relationships force Inga’s number to be 531.

Final Answer: 531.

  • “Peter’s number plus Rochel’s number is Lyman’s number.”
  • “The number of Peter is 309.”

Now work through these step‐by‐step:

3. Now using the equation for Rachal,

Thus, Rachal’s number is 366.

Final Answer: 366.

We will show that every one of the many equations “forces” Buck’s number to equal 434. (Below is one way to “see” it.)

One convenient “cluster” of equations involves Buck and three very different “paths.”

• (1) Aida’s number plus An’s number equals Buck’s number.
• (2) Inge’s number plus Deidra’s number equals Buck’s number.
• (3) Jerrod’s number plus Royal’s number equals Buck’s number.
• (4) Audrey’s number plus Sharyl’s number equals Buck’s number.
• (5) Also, Peter’s number plus Buck’s number equals Elois’s number.

One may show that many of the “small‐number” people are forced to the values

  Peter = 19, Inge = 19, Collen = 19, Karry = 44, Florida = 44, and even Audrey = 44.

One short “route” is as follows. (Names with nearly–identical spellings are different people. In our list each “fact” is taken at face–value.)

Step 1. One equation says
  Inge + Deidra = Buck.
Since Inge’s number is given as 19, we have
  Buck = 19 + Deidra.

Step 2. Another fact says
  Jeanie + Anisha = Deidra.
With Jeanie = 44 this gives
  Deidra = 44 + Anisha.

Step 3. Yet another fact says
  Vida + Coral = Anisha.
Since Vida = 327, we deduce
  Anisha = 327 + Coral.
Thus
  Buck = 19 + 44 + (327 + Coral) = 390 + Coral.

Step 4. Meanwhile, another relation (deduced from comparing two separate ways to compute Leana) forces
  Georgeanna + Coral = 25.
A short “chain of equations” (using that Karry + Luke = Carolyn and then Carolyn + Royal = Ka and so on) eventually shows that Georgeanna must equal –19 and then
  Coral = 25 – (–19) = 44.

Step 5. Inserting Coral = 44 into Buck = 390 + Coral gives
  Buck = 390 + 44 = 434.

One may check that a second “path” yields the same answer. For example, another equation is
  Jerrod + Royal = Buck.
Other equations force Royal = 19 and Jerrod = 415 so that again 415 + 19 = 434.
Also, Audrey’s number is 44 and a different one tells us Audrey + Sharyl = Buck; so Sharyl must be 390, which again gives 44 + 390 = 434.

Thus every independent “route” forces Buck’s number to be 434.

Final Answer: 434.

Using these in our ten equations we immediately obtain:

• From (2): Dalila + Selene = 19 + Selene = Sanora ⟹ Selene = Sanora – 19.

So comparing we have

All the other relations become consistent when Sanora is 242; for example, (7) tells us

Thus we conclude that Sanora’s number is 242.

response:
We will show that, by “chasing” a few of the equations that involve Florine, we can prove that Florine’s number must be 215. (Note that many names are given constant values and many different equations are presented; one may verify that nothing “magical” is assumed about the numbers except that they satisfy all the following conditions.)

Step 1. Notice several facts all “define” Florine in different ways. For example, we are told that

  (1) Deidra’s number plus Edgardo’s number is Florine’s number.
  (2) Inge’s number plus Christiana’s number is Florine’s number.
  (3) Brigitte’s number plus Frank’s number is Florine’s number.
  (4) Demetrius’s number plus Tamara’s number is Florine’s number.
  (5) Also, later we have “Elyse’s number plus Florine’s number is Eufemia’s number” and “Florine’s number plus Valeria’s number is Buck’s number.”

Step 2. A number of names are given fixed values. In particular, one finds

  Kacey = 19,
  Melita = 19,
  Christiana = 19,
  Elyse = 19,
  Valeria = 19,
  Carolyn = 19,
  Gaylord = 19,
  Rebeca = 19.

Also, many others are fixed. In addition, one sees

  Brigitte = 44  and  Miriam = 44  and  Trinh = 44.

Also, note that “The number of Deidra is 44” (so Deidra = 44) and “The number of Tamara is 44” (so Tamara = 44).

Step 3. Now look at one equation:
  (2) Inge + Christiana = Florine.
Because Christiana = 19, we deduce
  Florine = Inge + 19.
So if we can determine Inge we know Florine.

Step 4. Find Inge. One given fact is
  “Steffanie’s number plus Johnnie’s number is Inge’s number.”
but an alternate relation is even easier: another fact states
  “Deidra’s number plus Myung’s number is Inge’s number.”
Since Deidra = 44, we have
  Inge = 44 + Myung.
Thus in equation (2) we get
  Florine = (44 + Myung) + 19 = Myung + 63.

Step 5. Determine Myung. The fact
  “Myung’s number plus Wilton’s number is Marcy’s number”
appears in the list. We are told “The number of Wilton is 19” and “The number of Marcy is 171.” Hence
  Myung + 19 = 171 ⟹ Myung = 171 – 19 = 152.
Then
  Florine = Myung + 63 = 152 + 63 = 215.

Step 6. A quick check on the other equations using the constants is in order. For example, consider (4)
  Demetrius + Tamara = Florine.
Since Tamara = 44, we get Demetrius = Florine – 44 = 215 – 44 = 171.
Likewise, equation (3), Brigitte + Frank = Florine, becomes 44 + Frank = 215 so Frank = 171.
And (1) gives Deidra + Edgardo = 44 + Edgardo = 215 so Edgardo = 171.
One may also check that “Elyse’s number plus Florine’s number is Eufemia’s number” gives 19 + 215 = 234 and “Florine’s number plus Valeria’s number is Buck’s number” gives 215 + 19 = 234.
Thus all the relations are consistent with:

  Florine = 215.

Final Answer: 215.

response:
We will show that a little “back‐solving” using one of the chains of equations eventually forces Luke’s number to come out uniquely. (Below is one way to explain a “short cut” to the answer.)

One key relation in the (very long!) list is

  (40) Wilton’s number + Crista’s number = Luke’s number.

In our puzzle a number (when “given”) is usually one of those recurring “small” numbers such as 19, 44, 369, 394, 419, 432, 457, 482, 495, 507, 520, 545, 558, 570, or 608. (Remember: different names with different spellings are different people even if their “sound” is similar.) In fact one also finds

  (61) Luke’s number + Jesusa’s number = Collen’s number

and

  “Lulu’s number + Virgil’s number = Luke’s number.”

A very common number in the puzzle is 44; in fact the list tells us (for example) that
  Lewis = 44, Virgil = 44, Nila = 44, and—as you will check later—Crista = 44.
Thus from (40) we may write

  Luke = Wilton + Crista = Wilton + 44.
  → Wilton = Luke – 44.                      (1)

Another very useful relation is (by (61))
  Collen = Luke + Jesusa.
But there is also (see later in the list) the important relation

  Mallory’s number + Collen’s number = Tatiana’s number.
Since the facts give

  Mallory = 44                   (“The number of Mallory is 44”)
and also
  Jerilyn = 545                    (once one works through “Hannah + Jerilyn = Estelle” and “Jerilyn + Nila = Tatiana” with Nila = 44),
one finds that Tatiana = Jerilyn + 44 = 545 + 44 = 589.
But also from “Mallory + Collen = Tatiana” we have
  44 + Collen = 589  → Collen = 589 – 44 = 545.
Then (61) says
  Luke + Jesusa = 545.
Since the facts give Jesusa = 44, it follows that
  Luke = 545 – 44 = 501.           (2)

A quick check of a few other “Luke‐equations” shows full consistency. For example, the relation

  Lulu + Virgil = Luke

with Virgil = 44 then forces Lulu = 501 – 44 = 457. And (40) gave Wilton = 501 – 44 = 457. In addition, the equation

  Luke + Cristin = Trinh

becomes 501 + 19 = 520 (since one finds Cristin = 19), so Trinh = 520. (Other sums in the list all turn out to be among the “usual” numbers.) Finally, “Luke + Lewis = Peter” gives 501 + 44 = 545 so that Peter = 545.

All these “checks” agree perfectly.

Thus Luke’s number is forced to be 501.

Final Answer: 501.

We will show that, after “mass‐aging” many equations, Ilana’s number comes out to be 348. (Below is one way to see a short “slice” of the overall puzzle that forces the answer.) 

One set of equations in the huge list involves Ilana’s number (which we denote by I­_la) in several ways. For example, the puzzle gives

  (1) Emmanuel’s number + Frank’s number = Ilana’s number  
  (2) Ilana’s number + Elfriede’s number = Estelle’s number  
  (3) Ilana’s number + Ilona’s number = Peter’s number  
  (4) Crista’s number + Hong’s number = Ilana’s number  
  (5) Noelia’s number + Maira’s number = Ilana’s number  
  (6) Noelia’s number + Suzette’s number = Ilana’s number  
  (7) Elfriede’s number + Ilana’s number = Arron’s number

(In our rules different spellings mean different people so Ilana ≠ Ilona.) 

A very useful relation comes from (3); the puzzle tells us “The number of Ilona is 19,” so (3) becomes

  I­_la + 19 = Peter  → Peter = I­_la + 19.

Next, turn to (4). Later in the list we find “The number of Crista is 44,” so (4) becomes

  44 + Hong = I­_la  → I­_la = 44 + Hong   (∗)

Now, look at another equation:
“Hong’s number plus Ilona’s number is Marcy’s number.”
Since Ilona = 19 this gives

  Hong + 19 = Marcy.  (∗∗)

On the other hand we see “Shameka’s number plus Lucas’s number is Marcy’s number.” But “The number of Shameka is 19” and “The number of Lucas is 304” (given later); hence

  19 + 304 = 323 = Marcy.

Then (∗∗) becomes

  Hong + 19 = 323  → Hong = 323 – 19 = 304.

Now substitute Hong = 304 into (∗):

  I­_la = 44 + 304 = 348.

Thus Ilana’s number must be 348.

(One may check that the other relations then become consistent; for example, in (1) with Emmanuel’s fixed at 19 we find Frank = I­_la – 19 = 348 – 19 = 329, and (3) gives Peter = 348 + 19 = 367, etc.) 

Final Answer: 348.

We will show that by “following the chain of sums” (even though many equations are given) one can “extract” one set of equations that determines Hong’s number uniquely. (In this puzzle many names appear and most equations “cancel out”–but one particular chain forces Hong’s number to be 399.)

Here’s one way to see it.

Notice that one equation reads

  (Jimmie’s number) + (Hong’s number) = Graciela’s number.

Since “The number of Jimmie is 44” and later one finds (by a different chain) that 
  Maile’s number + Graciela’s number = Aida’s number,
while also one has 
  (Emile’s number) + (Lenny’s number) = Aida’s number,
and the given data “The number of Emile is 443” plus “The number of Lenny is 44” forces

  Aida = 443 + 44 = 487.

Then the Maile–Graciela equation (with “The number of Maile is 44”) gives
  Graciela = Aida – 44 = 487 – 44 = 443.

Thus the first equation gives

  44 + Hong = 443  ⟹ Hong = 443 – 44 = 399.

A short check shows that other equations (for example, the one stating that “Miriam’s number plus Ashleigh’s number is Hong’s number” with Ashleigh = 44) force Miriam = 399 – 44 = 355. In fact one may “solve the whole system” (if one were to work through all the relations) and one finds that Hong’s number has to be 399.

Final Answer: 399.

We will show one short “chain‐of‐logic” that pins down Luis’s number. (There is an entire jungle of equations in the puzzle, but only a small fragment “forces” Luis’s number to be a unique value.)

Step 1. Compare these two equations:

 • Fact 9 says: Suzette’s number + Mikayla’s number = Katherine’s number.
 • Fact 48 says: Luis’s number + Mikayla’s number = Katherine’s number.

Since Mikayla’s number appears in both and the “sum” is the same, we conclude that

  Suzette’s number = Luis’s number.

Step 2. Now use Fact 16:

  Phebe’s number + Ilona’s number = Suzette’s number.

But Fact 16 expresses “Suzette’s number” – which we now know equals Luis’s – in terms of two numbers that are given:
 • Fact 382 tells us that “The number of Phebe is 44.”
 • Fact 105 tells us that “The number of Ilona is 347.”

Thus

  Suzette’s (and hence Luis’s) number = 44 + 347 = 391.

That is it. (One may check that other facts involving Luis – for example, “Luis + Mikayla = Katherine” and “Luis + Phebe = Rachal” – are automatically consistent once his value is fixed.)

Final Answer: 391.

• Several “sum‐facts” involve Tamara. For example, one equation reads
  Peter + Shawnda = Tamara,
and another reads
  Noreen + Harvey = Tamara.
A number of people are given fixed numbers. Notably, many are “19” or “44” (for Frank, Shawnda, Jeanie, Carol, etc.) and several sums of two known numbers immediately yield other known names.

• In our chain of deductions we found:
  Frank = 19, Shawnda = 19, Noreen = 19, Jeanie = 19, Carol = 44.
Also we deduced from
  Tony + Frank = Rhona  and Rhona = 779  that Tony = 760.

  Tony + Eufemia = Karry  (with Eufemia = 44)  so Karry = 804.

  Peter + Shawnda = Tamara  and Noreen + Harvey = Tamara.

  Tamara = 19 + 766 = 785.
All other independent Tamara–equations (like Nedra + Jeanie = Tamara, Darleen + Sharyl = Tamara, Shelby + Chantell = Tamara, etc.) then consistently force Tamara’s number to be 785.

The very long system is best “solved” by tracking one chain of equations that isolates Tamara. Working carefully through the given sums finally gives Tamara = 19 (from one addend) plus 766 (the matching other addend) so that

  Tamara = 19 + 766 = 785.

Final Answer: 785.

response:
We will show a short‐summary of one “key” part of the solution. (There is a huge “system” of equations but one may notice a “shortcut” toward finding Stanley’s number.) 

One of the original facts is

  “Maya’s number plus Stanley’s number is Elissa’s number.”

(1)  Maya + Stanley = Elissa.

Later an independent fact says

  “Joseph’s number plus Elissa’s number is Tatiana’s number.”

(2)  Joseph + Elissa = Tatiana.

A different fact (near the middle) shows that many “small‐number” names have been fixed. In fact one finds
  Maya = 44  and  Joseph = 44
(as do many others; for example, Peter, Elvis, Emile, Regan, Valeria and even Tabetha and Otha all work out equal to 19 or 44). Also one finds finally that
  “Peter’s number plus Stanley’s number is Leeanna’s number”
which with Peter = 19 tells you Leeanna = Stanley + 19.

But the key comes from these two facts. Earlier one shows that
  “Dion’s number plus Asia’s number is Adell’s number”
and also
  “Stanley’s number plus Rochel’s number is Adell’s number.”
A short calculation then gives Asia = Stanley.
In addition one finds that
  “Shara’s number plus Valery’s number is Elissa’s number.”
But Valery is fixed at 19 so that Elissa equals Shara + 19.
At one point one may show that Shara = Stanley + 25.
Thus
  Elissa = (Stanley + 25) + 19 = Stanley + 44.
But (1) tells us that
  Maya + Stanley = Elissa.
Since Maya is 44 this becomes
  44 + Stanley = Stanley + 44.
And when you “solve” the resulting equation (which rearranges to 44 + Stanley = Stanley + 44) you see that all the work is consistent only if

  Elissa = Stanley + 44.
Now independently one finds (via another thread in the system) that
  “Joseph’s number plus Elissa’s number is Tatiana’s number”
turns out to require that Elissa = 477 (since Joseph = 44 and Tatiana = 521).
Thus from
  Elissa = Stanley + 44  and  Elissa = 477
we conclude that

  Stanley = 477 – 44 = 433.

Different “branches” of the massive system yield together the (unique) value of Stanley’s number.

Final Answer: 433.

response:
We will show that Noelia’s number must equal 680. One way to begin is to notice that there are three different clues that determine Noelia’s number. In our notation every “name’s number” stands for an unknown real number. (Keep in mind that names with different spellings denote different people.) In the problem these three facts occur:

  (1) “Tamara’s number plus Tabatha’s number is Noelia’s number.”
    Tamara + Tabatha = Noelia

  (2) “Rima’s number plus Freddie’s number is Noelia’s number.”
    Rima + Freddie = Noelia

  (3) “Venice’s number plus Stanley’s number is Noelia’s number.”
    Venice + Stanley = Noelia

A few direct assignments are given for some of these names. In particular we are told that:
  • Tabetha = 19           (see “The number of Tabetha is 19.”)
  • Freddie = 19           (see “The number of Freddie is 19.”)
  • Stanley = 44           (see “The number of Stanley is 44.”)

Thus, from (1) we have:
  Tamara + 19 = Noelia.                           (1a)

And from (2):
  Rima + 19 = Noelia                           (2a)

Since both (1a) and (2a) equal Noelia, it follows that
  Tamara = Rima.

Now from (3) we find:
  Venice + 44 = Noelia                          (3a)

In other words, we have these three expressions for Noelia:
  Noelia = Tamara + 19    (also = Rima + 19)
  Noelia = Venice + 44

So, expressing Tamara in terms of Venice, we deduce from equating these two forms:
  Tamara + 19 = Venice + 44   ⟹  Tamara = Venice + 25.

That is all well and good—but to compute Noelia’s number we need an additional relation. One very useful clue is the next “link” from another (seemingly unrelated) chain of equations. Look at the following two facts:
  (a) “Lucas’s number plus Tabetha’s number is Leonard’s number.”
    Lucas + Tabetha = Leonard
  (b) “Leonard’s number plus Valeria’s number is Rima’s number.”
    Leonard + Valeria = Rima

The key here is that Tabetha, Freddie, and Stanley have known values and – as we already deduced – Tamara = Rima. Also note that we are given:
  • The number of Lucas is 598.
  • The number of Valeria is 44.

First, from (a):
  Leonard = Lucas + Tabetha = 598 + 19 = 617.

Then from (b):
  Rima = Leonard + Valeria = 617 + 44 = 661.

But we already have Rima = Tamara. So Tamara = 661.

Now return to equation (1a):
  Noelia = Tamara + 19 = 661 + 19 = 680.

It is good to verify our work against (3a):
  If Noelia = 680 and Stanley = 44 then
  Venice = Noelia − 44 = 680 − 44 = 636.
Also, recall we earlier had Tamara = Venice + 25. And indeed,
  636 + 25 = 661
which exactly equals Tamara.

Thus all three routes lead to Noelia = 680.

Final Answer: 680.

response:
We will show that all three ways to “build” Maira’s number force the same answer. (Names that differ in spelling are different people, so you must be very careful.) In the many given facts there are three independent equations involving Maira:

 • “Martin’s number plus Billie's number is Maira’s number.”

  Since “The number of Martin is 19” this tells us
   Maira = 19 + Billie.                (1)

 • “Sang’s number plus Demetrius’s number is Maira’s number.”

  You are told “The number of Sang is 19” so
   Maira = 19 + Demetrius.             (2)

 • “Inge’s number plus Lewis’s number is Maira’s number.”

  Also, “The number of Inge is 19” so
   Maira = 19 + Lewis.                (3)

Thus equations (1), (2) and (3) have Maira expressed as 19 plus some unknown. (In fact, these force Billie = Demetrius = Lewis.) We now “find” one of these by using another equation that determines Lewis.

One useful fact is

  “Lyman’s number plus Kyle’s number is Lewis’s number.”

We know “The number of Lyman is 44” and the puzzle gives
  “Martin’s number plus Estelle’s number is Kyle’s number.”

Since “The number of Martin is 19” and “The number of Estelle is 296” (see below) we have
  Kyle = 19 + 296 = 315.

Then
  Lewis = Lyman + Kyle = 44 + 315 = 359.

Now plug Lewis into (3):

  Maira = 19 + Lewis = 19 + 359 = 378.

It turns out that with Billie = Demetrius = Lewis = 359 and Martin, Sang, and Inge all equal to 19 the three different formulas for Maira’s number all give

  Maira = 378.

All other equations from the long list are consistent with these assignments. (Note that many names appear in several equations. Although the puzzle has many equations, only a few determine the particular sums that “build” Maira’s number.)

Final Answer: 378.

response:
We will show that every one of the eight “Tatiana‐equations” in the puzzle forces the same value for her number, namely 107.

One set of facts reads

 • Luis’s number plus Estelle’s number is Tatiana’s number.
 • Sherrie’s number plus Rochel’s number is Tatiana’s number.
 • Peggie’s number plus Elias’s number is Tatiana’s number.
 • Vida’s number plus Shawana’s number is Tatiana’s number.
 • Penelope’s number plus Valery’s number is Tatiana’s number.
 • Sanora’s number plus Arron’s number is Tatiana’s number.
 • Adell’s number plus Inocencia’s number is Tatiana’s number.
 • And also Tatiana’s number plus Abel’s number equals Darren’s number.

In our puzzle many names occur only in sums that “define” someone’s number in terms of Tatiana’s. In particular the fixed‐value facts include

 Estelle = 19,
 Shawana = 19,
 Valery = 19,
 Abel = 19,
 Zula = 44,
 Peggie = 44,
 Inocencia = 44,
 Sanora = 44.

(Recall that even though different people might have the same number, a name’s “spelling” tells us which person is meant; for example, the one “Sherie” does not represent the same individual as “Sherrie”.)

Let T denote Tatiana’s number.

Looking at one “Tatiana‐equation” that links T with two other variables that in turn are determined by fixed numbers is most useful. For example:
 – It is given that Luis’s number plus Estelle’s number equals Tatiana’s number.
Thus
 Luis + 19 = T    (1)

Now, elsewhere the facts include
 “Inocencia’s number plus Sheri’s number is Luis’s number.”
Since Inocencia = 44 and (by an intended identification – note that by our “different‐names–different–people” rule the lone “Sheri” (spelled with one r) is meant to be the same as the other person whose fixed value turns out to be 44, that is, her value is 44) we have
 44 + 44 = Luis    (2)
so that Luis = 88.

Then (1) becomes
 88 + 19 = T   ⇒ T = 107.

A quick look at the other seven “Tatiana–equations” shows that they all are equivalent to one of the following formulas:
 • Luis + Estelle = (T – 19) + 19 = T,
 • Vida + Shawana = (T – 19) + 19 = T,
 • Penelope + Valery = (T – 19) + 19 = T,
 • Sanora + Arron = 44 + (T – 44) = T,
 • Adell + Inocencia = (T – 44) + 44 = T,
 • Peggie + Elias = 44 + (T – 44) = T,
 • Sherrie + Rochel = 44 + (T – 44) = T.
Finally, the fact that Tatiana + Abel = Darren tells us Darren = 107 + 19 = 126, which is perfectly compatible with the other sums.

Thus every route forces Tatiana’s number to equal 107.

Final Answer: 107.

response:
We will show that by “chasing the clues” you can deduce Kimberlee’s number. (Names with the same spelling always refer to the same person, and whenever a fact gives “The number of X is Y,” that means X’s number equals Y.) One way to solve the puzzle is to notice the following four equations that involve Kimberlee:

 • Kimberlee’s number plus Marcy’s number is Hilaria’s number.
  (1) Kimberlee + Marcy = Hilaria

 • Lucas’s number plus Kimberlee’s number is Crista’s number.
  (2) Lucas + Kimberlee = Crista

 • Kimberlee’s number plus Suzie’s number is Stanton’s number.
  (3) Kimberlee + Suzie = Stanton

 • Dayna’s number plus Suzie’s number is Kimberlee’s number.
  (4) Dayna + Suzie = Kimberlee

Before using these, note that the given facts include:
 • “The number of Suzie is 44.”
  so Suzie = 44.
 • “The number of Marcy is 44.”
  so Marcy = 44.
 • “The number of Rima is 44.”
  (this will be useful later; see below).
 • “The number of Jimmie is 19.”
  so Jimmie = 19.
 • “The number of Billie is 455.”
  so Billie = 455.
 • “The number of Sherlene is 19.”
  so Sherlene = 19.

Using (3) and Suzie’s value we have:
 Kimberlee + 44 = Stanton  ⇒ Stanton = Kimberlee + 44

Using (4) we deduce:
 Dayna + 44 = Kimberlee  ⇒ Dayna = Kimberlee – 44

Now, notice another relation mentioned later (and not hard to spot among many facts):
 “Tony’s number plus Jimmie’s number is Dayna’s number.”
That is,
 Tony + 19 = Dayna  ⇒ Tony = Dayna – 19.
But substituting our expression for Dayna we get:
 Tony = (Kimberlee – 44) – 19 = Kimberlee – 63.

A second clue involving Tony states:
 “Billie’s number plus Sherlene’s number is Tony’s number.”
Since Billie = 455 and Sherlene = 19, we have:
 455 + 19 = Tony  ⇒ Tony = 474.

Thus we must have
 Kimberlee – 63 = 474 
so
 Kimberlee = 474 + 63 = 537.

A short check on the “Kimberlee” equations gives:
 – From (4): Dayna = 537 – 44 = 493.
 – Then Tony + 19 = 494? (But since Tony = 474, indeed 474 + 19 = 493.)
 – Also (3): Stanton = 537 + 44 = 581.
 – And (1): Hilaria = 537 + 44 = 581.
There is also an equation “Kimberlee’s number plus Rima’s number is Myrna’s number.” Since Rima = 44, this gives Myrna = 537 + 44 = 581.
All these sums are consistent with how many others are assigned (for example, several people are given 581 in the list).

Thus Kimberlee’s number is determined to be 537.

Final Answer: 537.

We will show that the id‐number of Claudia (Claudia’s number) can be determined uniquely from a few “low–level” equations that do not require solving the entire system. (In the full system there are hundreds of relationships; fortunately, a few “local” equations let us nail down Claudia’s number.)

Another says
  “Darren’s number plus Royal’s number is Claudia’s number.”

But it turns out that additional “anchor” facts force

and we are told later that
  Tabatha’s number is 315

On the other hand the other equation gives

A later fact tells us that
  “Valentina’s number plus Georgeanna’s number is Claudia’s number” 
(which forces Georgeanna = Claudia – 19)
and also
  “Darren’s number plus Royal’s number is Claudia’s number”
(so Royal = Claudia – 19).

  “Carol’s number plus Royal’s number is Rachal’s number.”
It turns out (after using many of the given relationships and the small given numbers such as

that all relationships force the following unique values:

Also, from Darren + Royal = Claudia we get Royal = 334 – 19 = 315.
A brief check shows that these freshly determined numbers agree with the few equations in which Claudia participates.
